alert.note: Alert for Graham; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:51PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Norton and northwestern Graham Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 351 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Lenora, or 15 miles northwest of Hill City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Norton and northwestern Graham Counties, including the following locations... New Almelo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
